modules.title: Flood Preparedness
modules.description: Learn how to prepare for and respond to flood emergencies according to NDMA guidelines.
modules.descriptionHi: एनडीएमए दिशानिर्देशों के अनुसार बाढ़ की आपातकाल के लिए तैयारी और प्रतिक्रिया करना सीखें।

sections.title: Understanding Floods
sections.content: Floods are one of the most common natural disasters in India. They occur when water overflows from rivers, lakes, or coastal areas due to heavy rainfall, dam failure, or storm surge.

sections.title: Before a Flood
sections.content: Stay informed about weather conditions. Keep emergency supplies ready. Know your evacuation routes. Secure important documents in waterproof containers.

sections.title: During a Flood
sections.content: Move to higher ground immediately. Avoid walking or driving through floodwater. Stay away from electrical equipment if you are wet.

sections.title: After a Flood
sections.content: Wait for authorities to declare the area safe. Avoid floodwater as it may be contaminated. Check for structural damage before entering buildings.

How deep should floodwater be to avoid walking through it?

modules.title: Earthquake Safety
modules.description: Master earthquake preparedness and response techniques to protect yourself and others.
modules.descriptionHi: अपनी और दूसरों की सुरक्षा के लिए भूकंप की तैयारी और प्रतिक्रिया तकनीकों में महारत हासिल करें।

sections.title: Understanding Earthquakes
sections.content: Earthquakes occur due to the sudden release of energy in Earth's crust. India experiences frequent seismic activity, making earthquake preparedness crucial.

sections.title: Drop, Cover, and Hold On
sections.content: During an earthquake: DROP to hands and knees, take COVER under a sturdy desk or table, HOLD ON to your shelter and protect your head and neck.

sections.title: Earthquake Safety Kit
sections.content: Prepare an emergency kit with water, food, first aid supplies, flashlight, radio, and important documents.

quiz.question: What is the correct response during an earthquake?

modules.title: Cyclone Preparedness
modules.description: Learn to prepare for and respond to tropical cyclones and severe storms.
modules.descriptionHi: उष्णकटिबंधीय चक्रवात और गंभीर तूफानों की तैयारी और प्रतिक्रिया करना सीखें।

sections.title: Understanding Cyclones
sections.content: Cyclones are intense circular storms that originate over warm tropical oceans and are characterized by low atmospheric pressure, high winds, and heavy rain.

sections.title: Pre-Cyclone Preparation
sections.content: Monitor weather reports, secure loose objects, stock emergency supplies, and identify safe shelters.

sections.title: During the Cyclone
sections.content: Stay indoors, away from windows. If in a shelter, follow instructions. Avoid going out until authorities declare it safe.

quiz.question: What wind speed defines a cyclone?

modules.title: Fire Safety
modules.description: Essential fire prevention, detection, and evacuation procedures for various fire scenarios.
modules.descriptionHi: विभिन्न आग के परिदृश्यों के लिए आवश्यक अग्नि रोकथाम, पहचान और निकासी प्रक्रियाएं।

sections.title: Fire Prevention
sections.content: Keep flammable materials away from heat sources. Install smoke detectors. Maintain electrical equipment properly.

sections.title: Fire Evacuation
sections.content: Know your escape routes. Stay low to avoid smoke. Never use elevators during a fire. Meet at designated assembly points.

sections.title: Types of Fire Extinguishers
sections.content: Class A: Wood, paper. Class B: Flammable liquids. Class C: Electrical fires. Class K: Cooking oils.

quiz.question: What should you do first when you discover a fire?
options: Alert others and call emergency services
